results.title: The Venice Gondola Pageant
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Once a year the gondoliers of Venice compete for the honour of being the fastest gondolier. This video looks at all of the pageantry which accompanies this event as well as touring Venice itself, describing a little of its history and crafts, including the construction of the gondolas themselves, and what it is like to live there.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: Demon Christmas in Austria
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Christmas festivities in the small Austrian town of Altenmarkt begin early in December as St. Nicholas visits all the children in the town, accompanied by the Grumpus, the evil spirits of winter and the dark. The celebrations culminate in a parade through the town during which the mischief making Grumpus are driven out by the Perchtens, good spirits who announce the coming of spring.

results.title: Our Botanical History
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Under southern skies”.
Judy West of the Australian National Library offers an insight into Joseph Banks’ “Florilegium” which captures one of the world’s finest natural history collections. Host Sue Henckel then travels to far north Queensland where botanic artist, Betty Hinton, is continuing the work of Banks’ artist, Sydney Parkinson, which was begun two centuries ago.

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 7-9.
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Ray Quint, Diane Sundin and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: Episode 7, “Paying tax”, follows a group of employed and unemployed young people to illustrate how the Australian taxation system works. In “Working together” workers and employers at a car factory find that co- operation and dialogue can go a long way in removing problems between staff and management. In episode 9, “Reading and writing”, we discover that problems in effective communication and literacy are common and often the reason for poor work performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl McPhee, Ray Quint, Diane Sundin and SBS-TV

results.title: Belgium Salutes an Emperor
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Homogon, one of the greatest festivals of the middle ages. In the 16th century it was staged by the people of Brussels to entertain an emperor and his royal court. Today it is recreated in perfect detail. Among the 1300 performers are a group of titled aristocrats of Belgium who play the parts of their ancestors.

results.title: Jude the Obscure
results.creator_credit: Hugh David, Martin Lismore and BBC
results.brief_description: A television adaptation of Thomas Hardy’s novel which tells the story of the doomed Jude Fawley, a bright but poor stonemason. Trapped into marriage with Bella he is unable to realise his ambitions of education at Christminster. When Bella leaves him for Australia he meets his cousin Sue with whom he begins a long and tortuous relationship with tragic consequences, seeming to realise his aunt’s belief that marriage and the Fawley’s are not a possible combination. Stars Robert Powell, Alex Marshall and Fiona Walker.

results.title: Talking Trade
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari, Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Looks at ways Australia could expand trade to other countries, particularly the Arab world, by drawing on the language skills of its ethnic population. The video looks at examples of industries and individuals who have benefited by acknowledging their cultural roots, maintaining their language and recognising their own potential, for the key to trade with other countries is communication and understanding of other cultures. Accompanied by Teacher’s notes.

results.title: Fossil Fuels: Heading Towards 2010
results.creator_credit: Michael Edols, Mark Falzon and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Under southern skies”.
Continued life on this planet is dependent on our ability to maintain a balance with our biosphere and our resources. In the pursuit of a sustainable world, humans need to examine their direction on behalf of all living species. Sue Hanckel examines the paradox of a world which is trying to feed its billions and develop economically yet at the same time create a sustainable future for the generations to come. Particular attention is paid to our over dependence on fossil fuels and ways in which alternative forms of energy can be developed.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jim Sharman, Michael White and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: Maytime
results.creator_credit: Robert Z Leonard, Hunt Stromberg and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Jeanette MacDonald stars as Marcia, an opera singer in Paris who falls in love with a penniless American voice student (Nelson Eddy). Unfortunately she has just accepted a marriage proposal from an egocentric voice teacher, Nazaroff, played by John Barrymore. Years later, when chance reunites the two lovers, the enraged Nazaroff grants them their freedom… but in his own way.
